result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 05-10-2022 - Approved.**
Hearing on May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:22 AM Defendant Dejuan Lavarr Davis appeared by Zoom with attorney Preston James Smead who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment on April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Commissioner Kevin Costello spoke with JoAnn at WCS to clarify the defendant's bond conditions that Level 2 supervision will continue with the defendant as long as he is employed out of State and the defendant will phone in weekly in lieu of face-to-face weekly visits that is normally required under Level 2 supervision with WCS.
Posted Cash Bail on 03-21-2022

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 03/28/2022:  Defendant is no longer required to comply with the weekly in person check-ins with WCS as required once the defendant has everything in place for the downloads with CAM Monitoring.  Defendant to comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division by the close of business today to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

09:26 AM Defendant Dejuan Lavarr Davis appeared by Zoom with Attorney Brian Severson who appeared by Zoom for Attorney Preston James Smead.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Attorney Severson is requesting an arraignment date back before the Commissioner.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment back before the Commissioner and will allow for both the defendant and his attorney to appear by Zoom at the next date.  Attorney Severson previously filed a bail motion and is requesting for the Court to remove the requirement to comply with CAM Monitoring as a bail condition.  The State responds to the request of Attorney Severson.  The Court is willing to waive the weekly in person check-ins with WCS as required once the defendant has everything in place for the downloads on with CAM Monitoring.  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for March 29, 2022.
Amendment to earlier filing of Motion for modification of bond.
To modify conditions
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Letter dated 03/23/2022 requesting adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel.
